intro: Gerbera gerbera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with vibrant colors such as red, yellow, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features sturdy, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Gerbera gerbera thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
